intro: Lachnaea diosmoides var. tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf lachnaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy surface that helps reduce water loss.
